result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from prison funds at a rate to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  
Defendant shall not enter establishments where the primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.  
Defendant shall notify all health care providers of addiction history.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Miller

Sentencing hearing at 10-30-2015 10:00 am

Defendant in person & by Atty. Vincent J. Bobot.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Resolution reached; PSI recommended with both sides free to argue.  State moves to dismiss and read in 14-TR-2888.  Guilty plea entered.  Defendant admits to priors.  Court finds Defendant guilty and orders 14-TR-2888 dismissed and read-in.    Presentence Investigation Report ordered.  Court orders bond revoked and Defendant taken into custody.  8-24-15 Jury trial removed from Court's calendar.  PSI report shall be due two weeks prior to sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

$1200 cash bond amended to $5000 cash bond; Absolute sobriety; No controlled substances without valid prescription

Jury status hearing at 08-19-2015 09:45 am.
Jury trial at 08-24-2015 08:30 am.

Def in person & by Atty. Vincent J. Bobot.  Intern Samuel Tufford with Atty. Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Two day jury trial requested.  Not guilty plea entered.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 9:45 a.m.  DA Giernoth informs the Court that the Defendant has recent OWI charges pending in Racine County and requests modification of bond.  Argument by counsel.  Court amends bond to $5,000 cash.
Arraignment at 07-01-2015 01:15 pm

Def appeared in person.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Defendant is not sure where Atty. Bobot is today.  ADA Cannon has been in contact with Atty. Bobot.  Atty. Vincent Bobot now appears via telephone.  State has received the blood results.  Arraignment scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Arraignment at 06-03-2015 09:45 am

Atty Vincent J. Bobot appearing for Def.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Defense advises the Court that the Defendant is currently in Waukesha Memorial Hospital with medical problems.  Blood result has been received.  Arraignment continued.  Arraignment scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Arraignment on April 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Vincent J. Bobot.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed and reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered and status hearing requested.  Arraignment scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Vincent J. Bobot.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Per ADA Cannon, State is still awaiting blood results.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Vincent J. Bobot.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  DA to contact Sheriff's Dept. to have them follow up with State Crime Lab.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Def in person & by Atty. Vincent Bobot.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Counsel's first appearance.  Preliminary hearing time limits waiver continued.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to obtain blood results.  Hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Hearing on December 3, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty. Michael Bishop for Atty. Vincent Bobbitt.  Atty. Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  $1,200 cash bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear with Atty. Bobbitt.  Hearing scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
